intro: Viguiera chenopodina, commonly known as the desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Viguiera chenopodina is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
